intro: Drymaria engleriana, commonly known as the Engler's mouse-ear, is a low-growing perennial plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, rounded leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it produces clusters of pinkish-white flowers. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in alpine or arid environments. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant in gardens.
